prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions are 0.75 units in length, 0.75 units in width, and 0.75 units in height. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a sketch with a single face (face_1) containing one loop (loop_1). The loop consists of six lines: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0, 0.45] - line_2: Start Point [0.0, 0.45], End Point [0.0, 0.75] - line_3: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.06, 0.75] - line_4: Start Point [0.06, 0.75], End Point [0.06, 0.51] - line_5: Start Point [0.06, 0.51], End Point [0.06, 0.0] - line_6: Start Point [0.06, 0.0], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Do not apply any constraints yet. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch_scale: 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch. Extrude the 3D Sketch to generate the 3D model: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.75 - Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.0 Part 2: Curved Side and Tapered End Construct a shape with two cylindrical objects and a rectangular shape on top, positioned side by side. The height of this part is 0.3975 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: 180.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.5738, 0.06, 0.4912 Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Create a sketch with two faces (face_1 and face_2). Each face has a single loop (loop_1): - face_1: loop_1 with three arcs (arc_1) and one line (line_1) - face_2: loop_1 with three arcs (arc_2) and one line (line_2) Define the arcs and lines for each face: - face_1: - arc_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0487], Mid Point [0.0487, 0.0], End Point [0.0975, 0.0487] - line_1: Start Point [0.0975, 0.0487], End Point [0.0975, 0.1687] - face_2: - arc_2: Start Point [0.3, 0.0487], Mid Point [0.3488, 0.0], End Point [0.3975, 0.0487] - line_2: Start Point [0.3975, 0.0487], End Point [0.3975, 0.1687] Add the required constraints to form two closed cylindrical loops in each face. For both loops, apply the following constraints: - A Loop is always closed. - A loop can consist of multiple lines and/or arcs. - A loop can not consist of a line and a circle. - A loop can not consist of an arc and a circle. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch_scale: 0.3975. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch. Extrude the 3D Sketch to generate the 3D model: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.0 - Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.75 - Apply the "CutFeatureOperation" boolean operation for the current part with the previous part.</description>
